oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Free Hills Cemetery: Hill tombstone pieces
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 2250 Free Hill Road, Celina, Clay County, TN

Color photograph of the broken tombstone of [Graham] Hill, the bottom half of which is intact, and the top half of which lays on the ground. The lettering is mostly illegible. Death date appears to be 1900.

The Free Hills Cemetery is the oldest historic resource in the Free Hill community that was established by the freed slaves of Virginia Hill in the early 19th century. The community in the Upper Cumberland Plateau became home to additional African Americans following the Civil War and later was anchored by a community school built 1929-30 with support of the Rosenwald fund.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American cemeteries -- Tennessee; Cemeteries -- Tennessee
Tombs & sepulchral monuments
